utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard’s capsule should be re-entering the atmosphere any minute.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’ll be good to have him back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The Fantastic Four reunited.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, you had a good run, Fake Wolowitz. We’ll remember you with nostalgic fondness, the way we do the dial-up modem, the VHS tape, or, or Leonard’s gym membership.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We’re not kicking him out. Stuart and I have become good friends.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, one vote for, one vote against. Leonard, you’re the tiebreaker.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t have a problem with Stuart. Besides, he gives us a twenty percent discount at his comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I don’t sell my friendship that cheaply.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I can go thirty.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Welcome aboard, old chum.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, the NASA Web site says Howard’s final descent has begun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He left a boy, he returns a boy-sized hero.

utterance.speaker: Dimitri
utterance.content: Loops, calm down!

utterance.speaker: Howard (singing)
utterance.content: Baruch atah, Adonai, Eloheinu. Melech haolam, hamotzi. Lechem min haaretz

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The Jewish prayer for eating bread! We don’t have one for falling out of space! We did it! We’re on the ground! We survived!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: That was just the parachute. We still have another six miles to go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Waiting for my husband.

utterance.speaker: Man in Suit
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s coming back from outer space.

utterance.speaker: Man in Suit
utterance.content: I think this flight’s coming from Houston.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, I mean, he… Never mind. There he is! Howie!

utterance.speaker: Various others (all at once)
utterance.content: Howie! Howie!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whoa, thank you. Great to be back on Earth.

utterance.speaker: Howie Mandel
utterance.content: Uh, I think they’re here for me, Ringo.

utterance.speaker: Man in Suit
utterance.content: Mr. Mandel, I’m your driver.

utterance.speaker: Howie Mandel
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. That nut job was telling everybody on the plane he’s an astronaut.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I missed you so much.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I missed you, too. Where are the guys?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, it’s just me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I get it. They’re waiting back home with a big surprise party. Don’t worry, I can act surprised.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, I told them they could have you tomorrow night. Tonight, you belong to me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gesundheit. You okay?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I am now that you’re back. Come on, let’s go home so I can tear off those little pants.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. Just keep in mind astronauts lose a lot of muscle tone in space, so you might have to do most of the heavy lifting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I am very disappointed that I won’t be able to celebrate Howard’s accomplishment tonight.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Me, too. But we’ll see him tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, it’s just that in all the years I’ve known him, he’s never had the opportunity to receive my admiration. I was excited to see the look on his face when it finally happened.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, Pictionary. What are the teams?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How about boys versus girls?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that hardly seems fair. But I guess any team that I’m not on has a decided disadvantage.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Once again, unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, once again, I know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, round one. Here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Ready, set, go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, box? Uh, window?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Batman. Batman and Robin. Uh, Wonder Twins plus the monkey. Wonder Twins plus the monkey and Batman.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, gift? Uh, Present!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Present! Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard. Now, how can you not get that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: In what universe is that a present?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not a present, it’s the present. Look. There’s you and me. There’s Penny and Amy. We’re playing Pictionary. In the present.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, we’re gonna kill them.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a quark-gluon plasma.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s asymptotically free partons inside a quark-gluon plasma.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing with quarks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s an observational rebuttal of the Lambda-CDM model of the universe.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s a chocolate chip cookie.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How could you miss that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, if you want someone to guess chocolate chip cookie, you draw a glass of milk next to it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny got it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, only after I eliminated all the obvious answers. You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, uh, uh, uh, sausage. Uh, uh, uh, uh, bratwurst? Oh, oh, a hot dog.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Penny, aren’t you gonna draw something?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Relax, we got time, this is so fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A solar system. Uh, uh, uh, uh, um, unidentified flying liverwurst? I don’t…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Soon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come on, Leonard, I am spoon-feeding this to you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, uh, Casper the alcoholic ghost?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, that’s enough.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, hand. Uh, nail, polish?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yep!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, no, no. No. The word is Polish. See, look. Polish sausage. And the, the model of the solar system developed by Nicolaus Copernicus, a Polish astronomer. And then, finally, if that wasn’t enough, which it should have been, this is Madame Curie killing herself by discovering radium, who, although she was a naturalized French citizen, was Polish by birth.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Excuse me, the word is polish. See? Small P.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah. So it is. I guess we both share blame on this one.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie, you okay?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (off)
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you get a sea lion while I was gone?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s just allergies.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Took some Benadryl. I’ll be fine. So, did you miss me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Are you kidding? Every minute of every…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (has a coughing fit)
utterance.content: Ew. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sweetie, we don’t have to do this now.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yes, we do. You left right after we got married. This is like our honeymoon. Now, hold on to your hat. Oh. Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: A little dizzy. Must be the Benadryl. Switch places with me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Now, kiss me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernadette? Bernie? Bernie?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (waking suddenly)
utterance.content: That was amazing. You made me feel things I never…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, that was quick, and a little gross. Now, I know how she feels.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, you’re always full of fun little facts. Where did the expression got your ass handed to you come from?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I wonder if it’s from, like, ancient Rome where they’d actually chop somebody’s ass off and then go, here. You know, to appease Loseroneous, the god of losers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am not a loser. Pictionary is not a true test of any real intelligence or skill.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mmm, in all fairness, Pictionary has verbal skills, visual skills. It’s a pretty well-rounded game.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Lot of big talk from a man who can’t draw a chocolate chip cookie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, fine, pick another game. Amy and I will beat you at anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Let’s play Physics Fiesta.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on, what is that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a game that I just invented, in which the participants answer physics questions in remedial Spanish. Um, ¿Dónde está el boson de Higgs?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: En el acelerador de particulares.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bueno, mi amigo.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, we’re not playing some dumb made-up game.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All games are made up. They’re not found in nature. You don’t just dig in the ground, come across a rich vein of Rock’em Sock’em Robots.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just pick another game.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why don’t we do something athletic like go over to the university pool and play water polo?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No good, Sheldon doesn’t float.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is true. I have a higher than normal body density. If I run too deep a bath, I drown.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, let’s keep it simple. How about darts?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, that’s not fair either.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Darts is a bar game. You’ve been frequenting drinking establishments since you were of legal age.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s when it started.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, regardless, she has a distinct advantage in all tavern-based competitions. Pool, beer pong, wet T-shirt contests, they’re all out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Just for the record, I have never entered a wet T-shirt contest. I’ve won a few, but that’s just because I spill when I’m drunk, so…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We could go to the cadaver lab at UCLA and play real-life Operation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-uh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you sure? I mean, the nose doesn’t light up, but if the corpse is fresh enough, sometimes you can get the leg to jerk.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Ma, twinkle, twinkle, your little star is home. Ma, the chain’s on the door.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard? I thought I wasn’t going to see you till tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, Bernie’s not feeling well, so I thought I’d stop by, tell you about the greatest adventure of my life, see if you can make me feel bad about it.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Uh, uh, okay, hold on, I’m not decent.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right. Woman hasn’t tied her robe in 20 years. Suddenly she’s not decent?

utterance.speaker: Man’s Voice (off)
utterance.content: You want me to hide in the closet or go out the back?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Shh, you need to whisper.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ma, who is in there?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Uh, nobody. The TV is on.

utterance.speaker: Man’s Voice (off)
utterance.content: I only got one sock. Where’s my other sock?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who is that?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I told you, it’s the TV. Jay Leno lost a sock, it’s hilarious.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you’re busy, I can come back.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Just give me a second. Go, go, go, go.

utterance.speaker: Howard (to man climbing out window)
utterance.content: Dr. Schneider?

utterance.speaker: Dr Schneider
utterance.content: Oh, hello, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Dr Schneider
utterance.content: Um, house call.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re a dentist.

utterance.speaker: Dr Schneider
utterance.content: Yes, yes, I am. I think he’s on to us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, glasses off. Find Waldo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hurry up, find him, find him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m trying. Don’t yell at me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For goodness’ sake, he’s wearing a hat, glasses, and a red striped shirt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know what he looks like.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, there he is, I got him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, we win again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How could you not find him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because he’s hard to find. If he was easy to find, the books would be called There’s Waldo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: 57, 58, 59, that’s one minute.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Long division, long division. Go, go, go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Remember, show your work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m okay. I’m okay. I’m not okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Get up, we can’t lose at math.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ready, set, wrestle. One, two, three, pin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mwah!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stop that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mwah!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, do something. Amy, help. Amy, stop that. Amy, Penny, both of you, stop it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One to beam aboard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, you’re back. Oh, look at you. You, you look like you grew.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. The lack of gravity did decompress my spine, so I’m like an inch and a half taller. I’m going to the DMV tomorrow to get my license changed before I shrink back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, uh, come in, come in. Oh, I, uh, I didn’t think I was going to get to see you until tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, Bernadette’s a little under the weather and my mom’s kind of under my dentist.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait, your, your mother is sleeping with your dentist?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Former dentist. I need a new one now that I know where his hands have been.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So you’re wandering all around by yourself? That’s not the kind of hero’s welcome an astronaut should come home to.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s okay, you know, we space cowboys don’t do what we do for glory and fame. We leave that to your rock stars and your athletes and your Howie Mandels.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, hey, man, welcome back.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, Stuart, thanks. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I, I kind of live here now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just until he gets back on his feet, which are looking pretty good in the boots I bought him for his birthday.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Ah, he’s spoiling me and I love it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, so you guys are like buds now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, we hang out all the time.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Plus, he doesn’t have a girlfriend, I don’t have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s like we both had these holes in our lives, but now we fill each other’s holes.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, that sounds a little funny to an American ear.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Which part?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Just all of it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, so what do you guys got going on tonight?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Raj is taking me to the Sound of Music sing-along.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sound of Music sing-along? That used to be our thing, but that’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, Howard, it’s still our thing. Come with us, we’ll, we’ll get you a scalped ticket.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So I’d be sitting by myself?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We’ll switch. You’ll come sit with me after intermission.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So I, I, I’d be sitting by myself during Edelweiss?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, no, you guys go. Have fun.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, uh, will I get to see you tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Absolutely. See you, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Is he taller?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: At least my mother made her boyfriend climb out the window.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, standard state fair pie-eating contest rules are, no hands, first one to clean the pan wins.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: On the count of three. One, two…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. I’m a little concerned. Blueberries are rich in antioxidants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, with all those antioxidants, what if I run out of oxidants?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, we haven’t won a game all night. Now, you either stick your face in that pie or I’m gonna stick that pie in your face.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s rude.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: One, two, three, eat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, guys, guess who’s back from space.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Not now!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, ow, blueberry in my nose, blueberry in my nose!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Snort it down and keep eating!

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: You look familiar.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: Yeah, I just saw you on the news. You’re an astronaut.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, I am.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: Good for you. How about a piece of cheesecake on the house?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, thank you so much. I’ve been having the worst night. I just got back, and my friends don’t care, my wife’s sick, I went to my mom…

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: You want the cheesecake or not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, please. And I think it’s gonna be long, long time till touchdown brings me ’round again to find I’m not the man they think I am at home, oh, no, oh, no, I’m a rocket man. Perfect.
